snippet: Gov. Sam Brownback will not face charges over loans made to his re-election campaign by his lieutenant governor, the United States attorney said.
abstract: United States attorney's office in Kansas says federal investigation into loans made to re-election campaign of Gov Sam Brownback by his Lt Gov Jeff Colyer will result in no charges; Colyer made three loans totaling $1.5 million in 2013 and 2014.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Sam Brownback will not face charges over loans made to his re-election campaign by his lieutenant governor, the United States attorney said.

headline.main: No Charges Against Kansas Governor After Ethics Inquiry
headline.print_headline: No Charges Against Kansas Governor After Ethics Inquiry
